movies.title: La petite voiture
movies.plot: Septuagenarian Don Anselmo Proharan, a retired government minister, finds himself sharing living space with his son, a penurious, bourgeoisie solicitor and his family. Don Anselmo, a widower, is restricted to one room of the house, and his social life has narrowed to attending wakes, funerals, and visiting the cemetery. When his paraplegic friend Don Lucas, gets a motorized wheelchair, Proharan accompanies him to his wife's grave to leave flowers. Don Anselmo soon becomes obsessed with getting his own "little coach" and joining the subculture of other "cochetito" owners. However, when his tight-fisted son refuses to buy a chair for him, the old man tries several gambits to get one.
movies.simplePlot: Seventy-something Don Anselmo, a retired minister, becomes obsessed with owning a motorized wheelchair and fakes infirmity to get it.

biography.bio: He debuted in theater when he was 19 years old and later he worked in the company of the Lara theater where he played as a first actor during 16 years. He participated in a short in 1912 but his cinematographic career mostly began on the 30s, working more in cinema than in theater in the 40s and later on. Of short height and simple character, he usually played secondary roles of the typical spaniard with all its virtues and prejudices.
biography.name: José Isbert

biography.placeOfBirth: Jaraíz de la Vera, Cáceres, Extremadura, Spain
biography.bio: Pedro Porcel was born on February 27, 1910 in Jaraíz de la Vera, Cáceres, Extremadura, Spain as Pedro Porcel Bares. He was an actor, known for La petite voiture (1960), Mi calle (1960) and Échec au cyanure (1961). He died on September 14, 1969 in Vitoria-Gasteiz, Álava, País Vasco, Spain.
biography.name: Pedro Porcel

biography.birthName: José Luis López Vázquez de la Torre
biography.bio: Spanish actor. He started his career in theatre in 1939, when he was only 17, with the support of the director Modesto Higueras and the painter José Caballero. His first works were as actor, set decorator and costume designer in non-commercial amateur theatre plays, basically at the 'Teatro de las Organizaciones Juveniles (TOI)' and at the TEU. In cinema, he started as a costume designer in films mostly directed by José López Rubio and Rafael Gil and as an assistant director to Pío Ballesteros and Enrique Herreros. His debut as a professional actor was in 1946 at the 'Teatro María Guerrero' theatre in Madrid, playing roles in plays like 'El Anticuario', 'El vergonzoso en palacio' or 'La dama boba'. Later he formed part of the companies owned by Conchita Montes and Alberto Closas. His debut as a cinema actor was also in 1946 with a little role in _María Fernanda la Jerezana (1946)_. In 1951, in the film _Esa pareja feliz (1951)_, he appeared in the credits together with two debutant key directors in Spanish cinema: Juan Antonio Bardem and Luis García Berlanga. His first roles were comic roles in general, and increasingly important. In 1958 he started to have his first successes ('Una muchachita de Valladolid' in theatre together with 'Elisa Montes' and Alberto Closas, and The Little Apartment (1959) in cinema together with Mary Carrillo and Concha López Silva). Since that moment on, he acted in the best theatre companies and also became an almost indispensable figure in Spanish cinema in the following two decades. Some of his best films from this stage are La petite voiture (1960), Placido (1961), Atraco a las tres (1962) and Le bourreau (1963). He met film-makers like Marco Ferreri, Juan Antonio Bardem, José María Forqué and Luis García Berlanga, who were able to extract from his funniness amazing nuances like tenderness, dirtiness, meanness, absurd and even nonsense. His popularity raised dramatically after he worked together with Gracita Morales in several films of less importance under the direction of Mariano Ozores and also performed the main role in the TV series "Tercero izquierda". In the early 70s he surprisingly started to do good dramatic performances in films like _Peppermint frappé (1967)_, The Garden of Delights (1970), _Bosque del lobo, El (1970)_ (Best Actor Award in the 1971 Chicago Film Festival), _Mi querida señorita (1971)_ (Best Actor Award in the 1972 Chicago Film Festival), _Cabina, La (1970) (TV)_ (winner of an Emmy Award), or Parle, petite muette (1973). He made a great success with these films which even got stronger after the international effects caused by his TV film 'La cabina' and his contribution to George Cukor's Travels with My Aunt (1972). And this success set the rest of his career, full of successful films both dramatic and comic (_Escopeta nacional, La (1978)_, _Verdad sobre el caso Savolta, La (1979)_, La ruche (1982), _Corte del faraón, La (1985)_, Mi general (1987), _Largo invierno, El (1991)_... In 1985 he received the 'Medalla de Oro de las Bellas Artes' (Arts Gold Medal).
biography.name: José Luis López Vázquez

biography.placeOfBirth: Medina de Rioseco, Valladolid, Castilla y León, Spain
biography.bio: María Luisa Ponte was born on June 21, 1918 in Medina de Rioseco, Valladolid, Castilla y León, Spain as María Luisa Ponte Mancini. She was an actress, known for Voyage to Nowhere (1986), Le bourreau (1963) and La petite voiture (1960). She was married to Luis López Rueda. She died on May 2, 1996 in Aranjuez, Madrid, Spain.
biography.name: María Luisa Ponte

biography.bio: Antonio Gavilán is an actor, known for La petite voiture (1960), Kisses for Everyone (2000) and Torero, fra sogno e realtà (2001).
biography.name: Antonio Gavilán

biography.bio: Lepe was born on August 10, 1891 in Madrid, Spain as José Alvarez Joudenes. He was an actor, known for La petite voiture (1960), Placido (1961) and Nine Letters to Bertha (1966). He died on July 7, 1967.
biography.name: Lepe

biography.bio: Chus Lampreave was born on December 11, 1930 in Madrid, Madrid, Spain as María Jesús Lampreave. She was an actress, known for Volver (2006), Talk to Her (2002) and Broken Embraces (2009). She was married to Eusebio Moreno de los Ríos. She died on April 4, 2016 in Almería, Almería, Andalucía, Spain.
biography.name: Chus Lampreave

biography.bio: Ángel Álvarez was born on September 26, 1906 in Madrid, Spain as Ángel Alvarez Fernández. He was an actor and writer, known for Django (1966), Le bourreau (1963) and The Little Apartment (1959). He died on December 13, 1983 in Madrid.
biography.name: Ángel Álvarez

biography.bio: Carmen Santonja was born on July 4, 1934 in Madrid, Spain as Carmen Santonja Esquivias. She died on July 23, 2000 in Madrid.
biography.name: Carmen Santonja

biography.bio: Antonio Riquelme was born on November 9, 1894 in Madrid, Spain as Antonio Riquelme Salvador. He was an actor, known for La petite voiture (1960), Jeromín (1953) and La revoltosa (1950). He died on March 20, 1968 in Madrid.
biography.name: Antonio Riquelme

biography.bio: María Isbert was born on April 21, 1917 in Madrid, Spain as María Vicenta Ysbert Soriano. She was an actress, known for Viridiana (1961), Le bourreau (1963) and Mortadel et Filemon (2003). She was married to Antonio Spitzer. She died on April 25, 2011 in Villarrobledo, Albacete, Castilla-La Mancha, Spain.
biography.name: María Isbert

biography.bio: Jesusa de Castro is an actress, known for La petite voiture (1960) and Les enfants (1959).
biography.name: Jesusa de Castro

biography.placeOfBirth: Salamanca, Salamanca, Castilla y León, Spain
biography.bio: Antonio Jiménez Escribano was born on April 27, 1902 in Salamanca, Salamanca, Castilla y León, Spain as Antonio Giménez Escribano. He was an actor and writer, known for La petite voiture (1960), Bolero de amor (1970) and Scream of the Demon Lover (1970). He died on August 7, 1972 in Madrid, Spain.
biography.name: Antonio Jiménez Escribano
